page.title: 01The Village of Milford
page.content: The village of Milford covers two square kilometres. It is a typical Surrey village with a playgroup, two schools, three churches, several shops & a wide variety of organisations & clubs for all ages. The village is surrounded by wide areas of commonland & farmland. Walkers & horse riders can both enjoy the beauty of the countryside well away from the busy roads which criss-cross the area. The most widely grown crops are cereals and potatoes & there are several pick-your-own facilities for soft fruit & vegetables. In the N.W. corner, Peperharow Park, with the river Wey flowing through it from Elstead to Eashing, provides a beautiful setting for the therapeutic communty for adolescents for which Peperharow School is now used.
